result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerrianne M Paulson

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes appeared by video for Kerrianne M Paulson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Wynes is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kerrianne M Paulson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement.

1:17 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Kerrianne Mae Paulson appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

Court finds probable cause, and will hear comments from each side on bond

 Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests $1500.00 Cash with conditions: Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to testing to ensure compliance. 

Comments by Defendant on bond - has been compliant with L.E. requests

Court orders $500 Cash bond with conditions Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. 

Court advises defendant that as to child support warrants - court will schedule for review hrg.
Court advises def. to contact Public Def. ASAP and let them know she has this case set for this Wednesday.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
